text: when the left-wing Salvador Allende was
elected president of Chile in 1970 he
appointed l'Italia his ambassador to
Washington I am Juan Gabrielle Valdes
ambassador of Chile to the United States
I am in Washington where I was in 1976
as an assistant to a former ambassador
and former Minister Orlando Letelier in
1976 the exiled Orlando Letelier
was living in Washington Natalia was now
a leader of the opposition against the
junta and a powerful critic of the
secret police to be an ambassador of
Chile in Washington means to me not only
representing my country but also it
brings back to me the memories and the
story I lived in 1976 the memories of
somebody else who was ambassador of
Chile to Washington and was killed a
hundred yards from the house where I
live now on September the 21st 1976
Orlando Letelier
was driving to work in Washington down
Massachusetts Avenue Embassy Row on
Sheridan Circle his car turned right and
he drove past the residence of the
Chilean ambassador where for three years
he had lived
each morning when I open my window I
look at seriouser I can see straight a
circle from my window and I see the
place where Orlando's car exploded he
made only one mistake he was convinced
that nothing like this could happen in
Washington he was absolutely ensure that
Pinochet wouldn't dare to act here I was
not here in Sheridan Circle in that car
that morning because the night before
when Orlando called me to tell me that
he would pick me up at 8:30 or 9:00 in
the morning I had to tell him that I
couldn't come because my wife wanted me
to stay with our children she had to go
to the supermarket and that simple story
that very simple story changed my life I
have no idea what would have happened it
I'm if I were in that car the first
thing I did after I presented my
credentials to President Obama was to
come here with the members of my embassy
it was a return to a very important
moment in my life but it was also part
of the task of memory and healing that
the Chilean people has been carrying out
since the return of democracy 20 years
ago this situation changed me a lot
we lost our innocence in terms of young
people who were fighting with a lot of
idealism for democracy and human rights
but it created a situation of proximity
with evil that we had never imagined
this creates a very strong impact in a
young man and of course changes its
character
I left Washington with a certain feeling
of despair for what had happened this
has nothing to do with the spirit with
which I have come back which is of
optimism I see the city more beautiful
than it was at the time and I see the
people whom I loved at the time with 30
years more but with the same feeling of
solidarity and affection towards me and
towards Chile
